item.title: How to set up a shortcut to open/track/minimise an app on Linux
item.description: For e.g. with yakuake, by default the shortcut is F12, you can open it or track it anywhere, just the same window. If it’s focused, press F12 again gonna minimize it. Now let’s learn how to set up such a shortcut for our own whatever apps on Linux. You need to have xorg-xprop, xdotool, wmctrl, procps-ng installed. You’d want to set the terminal variable to your app’s launch command, and set the wm_class variable based on what you see when you run xprop WM_CLASS and click on your app window.
